reviews.text: The best most affordable place to get hotpot in flushing! The service is exceptional, the quality of food is excellent, and the spot is very clean!
Good
Its a la cart, but someone the things are ridiculously priced, like veggies

The atmosphere of the place was amazing, however the food was mid. The fresh slice cuts of meat were great, however the very cool big round place of meat was filled with frozen meat. I understand it was frozen meat, but the price was a little hefty, and it could have had other options for us to have fresher cuts of meat.

My family and I stopped in after a long wait at the restaurant next door, and weâ€™re so glad we did. We decided to try BeiJing Hot Pot, and it quickly became a new favorite. The food was delicious and reasonably priced, the staff were attentive and kind, and the atmosphere was very inviting. One of the best things about this spot is that it isnâ€™t all-you-can-eat, so you never feel rushed and can enjoy your meal at a comfortable pace. You can order as much as you like without breaking the bank ğŸ¦. I even joined their membership program, and Iâ€™m happy I didâ€”I can definitely see myself coming back often if they keep up this level of quality.

Cheaters!  We have been here 2 years ago, when they just opened, and since then quality and quantity dropped dramatically!  We ordered round roll meat and they gave us twice less amount!!!!!!  And itâ€™s 30$!   Thatâ€™s extremely disturbing when they think you just not going to notice that and can literally steal your money!

Meats are fresh and the soup is tasty. If you like lamb, order the large side, it is more of valve.
First time dining this Beijing style hotpot! Good experience! We ordered a lot food all good! Will back to dining again!
Excellent food and service
The service is pretty good and environment is cozy!! Also has an event can get free dessert! It is good to give me a try! I went here with my sister and we both like it and super excited!!!
I really liked the service and the atmosphere. The food really depends on what you order. the fried rice was a little bland and the cooked lamb tasted weird. Everything else was solid
Complimentary ice cream, kids really enjoyed!

I've been to a lot of hotpot restaurants in the city. BeiJin Hotpot is a very average hotpot place. It's good, but hotpot is always good. Nothing exceptional for the price. The meat was good, maybe if we ordered different types of meat we would've had a better experience. There's nothing wrong with our dinner; we were just a bit disappointed. All in all, for the price range there are better places to go to.
amazing quality of food! Love the vibe and kids friendly as well.

We found a huge bug in our hotpot broth on the mushroom during our visit. We were told that it was due to the mushroom being â€œfreshâ€ but shouldnâ€™t ingredients be washed before serving?? While the servers did apologize, the incident left us feeling uncomfortable and disappointed. Cleanliness and food safety are basic expectations, and this experience fell short. The apology was appreciated, but more could have been done to make things right. In addition, there were two birds that flew into the restaurant.. did not make this experience any better. Unfortunately, we left feeling unsatisfied and would not return.
So yummy!

ğŸ”¥ Craving late-night hotpot? Check out @beijinghotpot_nyc â€” NYCâ€™s first authentic Beijing-style copper hotpot spot, right in Flushing!

We went all in with their Beef Super Roll Combo and chose two amazing broths: rich Tomato ğŸ… and savory Pork Belly ğŸ·. The space is a cozy blend of traditional Beijing decor and modern vibes, perfect for a chill dinner or late-night hang.
Open daily until 6AM, it's a must-visit for all the night owls.
Nice hotpot

I gotta say, it was 5/5 stars.The food was awesome and yummy, had 2 bathrooms for both gender (I think thatâ€™s right because I forgot). The waiters and service was amazingly nice. The restaurant is also very nice and not plain, the looks are great. The seating was 4/5. You can also have about 16 people in your party and there is not a lot of smoking. Nice
environment and quiet. The bad part comes, there isnâ€™t much wheelchair
accessibility because the chairs and sofas
arenâ€™t wheelchair accessible and itâ€™s hard
2/5. Another bad is the food is expensive
for poor people, 2.5/5. How far is it now, it is about 9.5 minutes from church to place for walking, 3.9 for bus, 3.6 for car,0.7 for plane and 1.2 for train. How many seats, about 50 seats and 46.5 feet of sofa. Large vegetarian meals and food. Itâ€™s hard to find parking most times but most are free parking! Best restaurant ever been!

Good Hot pot place. The atmosphere was nice and the service was great. The staffs really helped us a lot and were attentive. Food was good with varieties on the menu. Iâ€™ve been to places with more and less but Beijing was in-between (more meat options but less veggie options). Location is easy to get to, lot of cafes and things to do around. Worth a visit if near the area! Recommend!
Is this heaven?

First hot pot experience and we loved it! Everything we tried was delicious and the experience was fun. The mildest spicy broth was a spicy like we have never experienced before (it was intense, even though we usually like spicy). Weâ€™ll definitely be back with friends!

Step into Beijing Hot Pot on Prince Street and be transported straight to the capital of China. This spot beautifully blends traditional Beijing style decor with sleek modern touches creating a cozy yet stylish atmosphere. The staffs are warm, welcoming, and attentive making you feel right at home the moment you walk in. Their authentic copper pots filled with rich, flavorful broths serves as the perfect base for their fresh and high quality ingredients. Each dip into the bubbling pot brings bold flavors and satisfying bites. Beijing Hot Pot is a true authentic experience that leaves you wanting for more.
Delicious hot pot! Fresh ingredients, rich broth, and amazing flavors. Highly recommend for a tasty, satisfying meal!
Excellent taste, excellent service
å¥½åƒï¼

Extremely Disappointed â€“ Poor Food Quality and Serious Health Concerns

I recently had dinner at Jingmentong Hotpot with a friend, and it was an extremely disappointing experience. The quality of the meat served was noticeably poor and did not seem fresh at all. Not long after we got home, both of us experienced severe diarrhea, which we strongly suspect was caused by the food we ate there.

This was not just an unpleasant dining experience â€” it was a serious health concern. I urge the restaurant to take a closer look at their food handling and safety standards. Unfortunately, I will not be returning, and I wouldnâ€™t recommend this place to others until improvements are made.
Food, service, everything was amazing. We got the specialty fruit teas, mushroom broth and medium spicy broth. Everything was absolutely incredible. Love this place
It's expensive, but it's delicious. There's free ice powder for dessert!

Jingmen Copper Hotpot in Flushing is a gem for hotpot lovers! The broth options are richâ€”spicy and herbalâ€”both packed with flavor. The meat slices (especially lamb) are tender and fresh, and the DIY sauce station lets you mix your perfect dip.
Service was attentive, and the copper pots add a traditional touch. Portions are generous for the price (~$60/person).

A must-try for hotpot cravings!

âœ… Fresh meats & seafood
âœ… Cozy atmosphere
âœ… Great for groups
Excellent service ,Xiaohui take care of me she was so sweet and so attentive,I love the food everything the whole experience it was amazing  10/1000âœ¨

AMAZING SPOT âœ…  Food here is great ! Service is great ! Xiaohui was my server ! She is lovely, attentive , and made Great suggestions as it was my first time here ! Definitely will be back ! Wonâ€™t regret ğŸŒŸ

So good, Iâ€™m so full. Thank you  ğŸ‘ğŸ”¥
Great service ğŸ™Œ.

I didnâ€™t find the flavor particularly special. It felt similar to most hot pot places, just with different cookware. What really stood out, though, was the server â€” and not in a good way. She was physically present, but it honestly felt like her soul had left the building. She moved around like she was on autopilot, clearly just waiting for her shift to be over. To make things worse, the guest at the table behind me kept shaking his leg nonstop, which made my chair wobble the entire time. Maybe he wasnâ€™t being very considerate, but I also think the way the tables and chairs are arranged is part of the problem. If you can feel every little movement from the people around you, it takes away from the dining experience. My boyfriend was clearly still interested in eating, but unfortunately, I ended the experience early and we left. I just couldnâ€™t enjoy the meal under those conditions.
If you really like the style of Beijing hot pot, it might still be worth a try. After all, it is a very traditional branch of hot pot, and seeing a large plate of meat brought to the table is an impressive sight

Really good meat and base soups. Old China vibes with spacious booths and private areas as well. Thoroughly enjoyed the food and they open til super late so itâ€™s a plus for after party food.

First time here. We had a great time. We had the mushroom soup and medium spicy soup. Ordered wagyu beef, snow-covered beef, vegetable platter, and seafood platter. Also had their homemade mochi. All very good. Our server, Ann, was absolutely amazing. Best service I've had in a while. We will be back again in the future.

We had an incredible experience here last night!  We were greeted by one of their staff as soon as we arrived the restaurant, and didnâ€™t have to wait since we made a reservation. We ordered the spicy lamb scorpion pot as well as a bone broth pot, and everything tasted amazing. The sauce bar is very comprehensive, and thereâ€™s a dessert bar where you can get some refreshing dessert such as ice jelly. Besides the food, we really enjoyed the service hereâ€”everyone was super helpful and friendly, especially yh, who served our table. We went home with lots of leftover thatâ€™s enough to make up another meal. We are definitely going to come back with friends soon!

This is an excellent hot pot experience! The staff (especially Jing) was pleasant and took good care of us. The hot pot bases were extremely delicious (the spicy one is really spicy!!), and the meat was of extremely good quality! Highly recommend!

Overall, it was a really great experience! Our server, Jing, was really attentive through the entire night and the service was spectacular. All of the meat was very fresh and the quality was incredible. I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a great hotpot experience!

Nice environment and fresh food. The service was friendly and constantly came by to check on our soup base and our table was very clean and organized.
The interior felt like we were really in China!

Our waitress Soya was very accommodating and thoughtful with service. We will definitely come back again!

Beijing Hot Pot offers an incredible dining experience! The food was absolutely delicious, with a wide variety of options to choose from. The service was great as wellâ€”attentive and friendly throughout our meal. What really stood out was how traditional and authentic the entire experience felt, from the flavors to the ambiance. The restaurantâ€™s style is very much Chinese, adding to the overall charm and making it a truly immersive experience. If youâ€™re looking for authentic hot pot, this is definitely the place to go!

Had an amazing experience here! The spicy broth was the perfect level of spice and all of the food ingredients were so fresh! It was delicious, and our serve Soya was so nice and helpful! She made the dining experience very satisfying. I would come here again

My clients and I were just walking by and it seemed like a pretty nice place to go. We were not disappointed and turned out to be an amazing choice. Jing our server was amazing and gave us suggestions. She expertly suggested we not go too spicy and said we could always â€œaddâ€ more. It turned out we didnâ€™t need too. I will be going back.

We had a fantastic experience. Stopped in for our first ever hot pot and had so much fun. Our server Soya was absolutely wonderful and gave us great suggestion. She helped us navigate our first hot pot experience and it was great.

We had a fantastic experience at this hot pot restaurant! The food was absolutely delicious, with fresh ingredients and rich, flavorful broth options that made every bite enjoyable.  What truly made the visit memorable was the service, especially from our server, Ann. She was incredibly attentive, friendly, and went out of her way to make sure we had everything we needed. Annâ€™s warm hospitality added so much to the dining experience.With great food, excellent service, and very reasonable prices, this place is perfect for anyone looking for an amazing hot pot experience. Highly recommended!

We had a wonderful experience at this spot in Flushing Chinatown! The food was delicious with a great variety of choices. Although it's definitely on the pricier side, the attentive and friendly servers made it worth it. The vibe inside was perfect, from the lighting to the music. I loved everything about it and will definitely be back on my next visit!

Itâ€™s my first time here recommended by my good friend. The place is clean and all staff are really welcome to service. Food is fresh and great. Moreover, all the plate and pot also beautiful for taking picture if you are the photo person, this place is really for you too.

We had a wonderful time! Food was delicious and easy to book. The staff was lovely and accommodated an earlier booking time last minute. They also accommodated vegetarian options for the broths. Our waitress Soya was very helpful. Will return!

They serve delicious Beijing style copper pot hotpot. Meat was fresh and delicious. Interior design was superb with good decorations. Service was excellent. Very pricey but good experience. Decent sauce bar that you have to pay for.

Found this hidden hot pot place while looking on google for places to eat late night. Itâ€™s actually pretty good I was skeptical because it didnâ€™t have much reviews on it. The concept is just like other hot pot places. I ordered the two flavor pot, premium beef slices, beef slices, frog legs, noodles. The spicy broth was good. I really liked how there were more seafood options compared to other hot pot places. Everything is good the atmosphere was nice the service was good and lots of options for the sauce bar.
Great atmosphere, food and service! We usually come here if my family wants to have hotpot in Flushing. Love Corolla lamb roll and beef super roll. Also, Huiâ€™s service is incredible today!

One of the best hot pot places weâ€™ve been to! Great food and good ambiance. Everything was very fresh. The mushroom broth was impeccable. Unlimited small eats and dessert. We had a great time and the staff were very friendly and kind (shoutout to our server Soya!)

The dinning experience at BeiJing Hot Pot was great and the staff Xiao Hui was very attentive. The vibe was perfect with the interior decor, lighting, music and distinctive food presentation. Ingredients were fresh and delicious. Broth was flavourful and lots of ingredients came with the soup base. Decent sauce bar with multiple options. Ordering process was easy and intuitive. Pricing set on a higher end, but portion was huge too, so itâ€™s good to come in groups to share. Iâ€™ve came here a few times and would definitely come back again!

Place is great, we went there for my wife's birthday, since she wanted to go to a good hot pot place. Let me tell you, it can't go better than this place. As authentic as it should be. The staff is super friendly and attentive, and the food was great as well. Reservation is highly recommended, otherwise you're gonna be on a waiting list, but it's ok, the place doesn't close that fast. At some point we were the only European faces speaking other languages than Chinese or English, which is a good sign for the place to be authentic. I highly recommend BeiJing Hot Pot, and will definitely be back again.

Hui was super friendly and helpful. She offered excellent services which boosted the experience to the next level. The hotpot of course was also amazing. We all loved the newly released lamb hotpot. Will for sure come back:)
